Reviews.Title: good simple phone
Reviews.Author: Jon T. Stokkeland "Stokkeland"
Reviews.Content: I just needed a basic unlocked phone to use with prepaid GSM service - this one is all good, there is only two things to "complain" about:1. The volume adjustement buttons are active when phone is closed, so it keeps changing between loud and soft in my pocket2. It doesnt have T9 word recognition in text typing (but you probably dont get this phone if your primary use is text/sms anyway)battery lasts 4+ days.

Reviews.Title: Simple Flip Phone that works GREAT
Reviews.Author: JustMeDawn
Reviews.Content: My husband refuses to enter into this century's technology, so when he needs a phone it is difficult to find a GOOD flip phone. We have gone through several (at least 8) that lacked reception, in-call volume options, SUPER easy options. This one has it all! He can adjust the ringing volume and it doesn't adjust itself, he can receive and call from inside his shop (metal building) and he can hear me when I call. Very happy with this purchase :)

Reviews.Title: Simple use
Reviews.Author: Gregory Glenmore Creech
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother because of it's ease of use. She loves it and wouldn't trade it for the world.

Reviews.Title: Decent phone
Reviews.Author: Richard T. Longstreth
Reviews.Content: This is a "no frills" phone. I got it because I was wanting to ditch the traditional cell phone companies over-charged monthly plans and save some money. This phone helped me to do that and I went from over a $1000 per year in cell phone expenses down to approx. $250. If you don't think that you can make it using a basic phone and you need to have Bluetooth, apps, the internet, etc... choose another phone. If you're aim is to go inexpensive, this phone may be what you're looking for. I've been using it now for about 5 or 6 months and it does everything I want it to do... IE - I can talk to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: This phone should not be in the market.
Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: Very poor excuse of a phone I tried using it for one week and went back to my previous phone.

Reviews.Title: battery dead upon arrival
Reviews.Author: kw "kw"
Reviews.Content: the battery was dead. It measured 2.2V instead of 3.7V as indicated on the battery label. Also charging for 2 hours did not change it.The battery and phone were brand new, every nicely wrapped in original state.returned the item

Reviews.Title: Makes calls. Can't do much else
Reviews.Author: K. Peterson
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for someone who didn't want a smartphone. Honestly i think they'd be better off with an older smartphone where they only use the basic calling features.The 'extra features' of this phone are unbearably bad. Even the texting and messaging program is completely frustrating to use.Giving it 3 stars because I bought it to make calls and it does that just fine. If you're looking for a phone where you can even use some of the other features occasionally, i would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: No blutooth
Reviews.Author: UncleDuke
Reviews.Content: I mistakenly assumed the product had blutooth capability; otherwise the phone is okay; basic cell phone but not quite exactly what I expected

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE!
Reviews.Author: DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!  WHEN I RECEIVED THIS PHONE THE PACKAGING THE PHONE WAS IN WAS TORN AND THE PHONE WAS PROGRAMMED IN SPANISH!

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
GSM Tri Band GSM 900 1800 1900
VGA camera 640x480 pixels; Video capable
WAP 2.0/xHTML; miniUSB; Mini-SIM
SMS, EMS, MMS, Instant Messaging
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola V237 Unlocked GSM Flip Phone with VGA Camera, Video Capabilities and Internet Browser - Black
